channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: LLaMA-Omni: Seamless Speech Interaction with Large Language Models
item.description: We build our model based on the latest Llama-3. 1-8B-Instruct model.

item.title: PaperQA: Retrieval-Augmented Generative Agent for Scientific Research
item.description: We present PaperQA, a RAG agent for answering questions over the scientific literature.

item.title: Mini-Omni: Language Models Can Hear, Talk While Thinking in Streaming
item.description: We also introduce the VoiceAssistant-400K dataset to fine-tune models optimized for speech output.

item.title: MemoRAG: Moving towards Next-Gen RAG Via Memory-Inspired Knowledge Discovery
item.description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) leverages retrieval tools to access external databases, thereby enhancing the generation quality of large language models (LLMs) through optimized context.

item.title: GeoCalib: Learning Single-image Calibration with Geometric Optimization
item.description: This single-image calibration can benefit various downstream applications like image editing and 3D mapping.

item.title: MiniCPM: Unveiling the Potential of Small Language Models with Scalable Training Strategies
item.description: For data scaling, we introduce a Warmup-Stable-Decay (WSD) learning rate scheduler (LRS), conducive to continuous training and domain adaptation.

item.title: SciAgents: Automating scientific discovery through multi-agent intelligent graph reasoning
item.description: A key challenge in artificial intelligence is the creation of systems capable of autonomously advancing scientific understanding by exploring novel domains, identifying complex patterns, and uncovering previously unseen connections in vast scientific data.

item.title: Can LLMs Generate Novel Research Ideas? A Large-Scale Human Study with 100+ NLP Researchers
item.description: Recent advancements in large language models (LLMs) have sparked optimism about their potential to accelerate scientific discovery, with a growing number of works proposing research agents that autonomously generate and validate new ideas.

item.title: LongCite: Enabling LLMs to Generate Fine-grained Citations in Long-context QA
item.description: Though current long-context large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated impressive capacities in answering user questions based on extensive text, the lack of citations in their responses makes user verification difficult, leading to concerns about their trustworthiness due to their potential hallucinations.

item.title: iText2KG: Incremental Knowledge Graphs Construction Using Large Language Models
item.description: Our method demonstrates superior performance compared to baseline methods across three scenarios: converting scientific papers to graphs, websites to graphs, and CVs to graphs.

item.title: Mutual Reasoning Makes Smaller LLMs Stronger Problem-Solvers
item.description: This paper introduces rStar, a self-play mutual reasoning approach that significantly improves reasoning capabilities of small language models (SLMs) without fine-tuning or superior models.

item.title: Large Language Model-Based Agents for Software Engineering: A Survey
item.description: The recent advance in Large Language Models (LLMs) has shaped a new paradigm of AI agents, i. e., LLM-based agents.

item.title: Towards a Unified View of Preference Learning for Large Language Models: A Survey
item.description: Finally, based on our unified perspective, we explore the challenges and future research directions for aligning large language models with human preferences.

item.title: optillm
item.description: Optimizing inference proxy for LLMs

item.title: Docling Technical Report
item.description: This technical report introduces Docling, an easy to use, self-contained, MIT-licensed open-source package for PDF document conversion.

item.title: RealisDance: Equip controllable character animation with realistic hands
item.description: 2) The hands generated using the DWPose sequence are blurry and unrealistic.

item.title: RobustSAM: Segment Anything Robustly on Degraded Images
item.description: Segment Anything Model (SAM) has emerged as a transformative approach in image segmentation, acclaimed for its robust zero-shot segmentation capabilities and flexible prompting system.

item.title: KGRefiner: Knowledge Graph Refinement for Improving Accuracy of Translational Link Prediction Methods
item.description: The Link Prediction is the task of predicting missing relations between entities of the knowledge graph.

item.title: FLUX that Plays Music
item.description: This paper explores a simple extension of diffusion-based rectified flow Transformers for text-to-music generation, termed as FluxMusic.

item.title: One-Shot Diffusion Mimicker for Handwritten Text Generation
item.description: Extensive experiments demonstrate that our method can successfully generate handwriting scripts with just one sample reference in multiple languages, even outperforming previous methods using over ten samples.
